headline: Buttermilk Strawberry Shortcake
description: Light and airy buttermilk biscuits are topped with juicy, fresh strawberries in this dessert favorite.

video.description: See how to make strawberry shortcake with airy buttermilk biscuits.
video.name: Buttermilk Strawberry Shortcake

name: Buttermilk Strawberry Shortcake
recipeIngredient: 0.75 cup chilled unsalted butter, cut into small pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, 1/3 cup white sugar, and salt in a mixing bowl.

Cut in cold butter with a knife or pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. (If desired, place flour mixture into the work bowl of a food processor with the butter; pulse several times to cut butter into the flour mixture. Transfer mixture to a mixing bowl, and proceed.)
Stir in buttermilk until the flour mixture is moistened.
Drop 1/3-cup scoops of the dough 2 inches apart onto the prepared baking sheet.
Brush biscuits with heavy cream and sprinkle generously with turbinado sugar.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes.
Mix together the sliced strawberries, 1/4 cup white sugar, and lemon juice in a large bowl. Allow berries to rest until juices develop, about 30 minutes.
Serve the strawberries with juice over the biscuits.

review.reviewBody: I prefer deserts that aren’t super sweet and these shortcakes fit the bill. I followed the recipe as written and it was a hit. Will definitely make again.
Great! Made as written.
This was light and soft and absolutely delicious! I used real buttermilk (not the powdered buttermilk) and was very please to have small shortcakes for the freezer. Thanks!

Exactly what I was hoping for in a shortcake! I did not brush biscuits with cream or add turbinado sugar (I didn't have either) and it didn't make any difference. They turned out great! Hint....I used powdered buttermilk that I get at local health food store. Check it out! This shortcake recipe is a keeper!!
Fantastic biscuit!
Delicious biscuits with or without strawberry topping. Wonderful with honey as well.
m Made it 1st about 7 years ago. Was wonderful and it was asked for again...

The biscuits needed a little more buttermilk to make them spoonable, but they had a good flavor. Not too sweet so it didn't steal anything from the strawberries, which should be the star of this recipe.

These are perfect. I followed the recipe with only one groceries-are-an-hour-away change! I used kefir instead of buttermilk and it worked fine. My husband loved it so much, he cooed about how light and crunchy they are at the same time, how he’d only had the spongy store-bought ones before and these are better!

I didn’t like it at all it taste OK. But the texture was too dry for drop biscuits it was like a rolled biscuit amount of milk just wasn’t enough milk. So the first ones came out and they look like rocks. Because I had to sort of rolled them, and the second batch I rolled in smashed.
Excellent!
This tastes exactly like Bisquick shortcake but made from scratch. Absolutely delicious, I ate way more of these than I should have.
These shortcakes are delicious! They are crunchy on the outside and light and fluffy on the inside.

My daughter asked for strawberry shortcake for her birthday and I'm sooo glad I used this recipe. This was the best strawberry shortcake I ever had and everyone loved it. I made exactly as directed- would not change a thing. This will be my go-to recipe for strawberry shortcake from now on.

I halved this recipe and let the strawberries sit for longer than 30 minutes. The shortcakes came out great, will definitely make again! I ended up combining the dry mixture with the butter by using cold (out of fridge) cubed butter and using a pastry cutter to getting it into crumbs. 

I also had some lemon curd lying around so I had some on the side with it and it was delicious!

I made this recipe almost exactly as written (and tripled it for a large 4th of July party)- which yielded me 48 shortcake biscuits. Instead of brushing the top of the unbaked biscuits with heavy cream, I used an egg wash. I also baked them at 400 degrees. Also instead of dropping them by spoonfuls, I divided each recipe of the dough into 2 and patted them into circles and cut them into wedges-8 wedges per 1/2 half of the dough. They were delicious!!!!! Make sure you put the sugar on top of them, it makes a huge difference.
Wonderful recipe. I would make smaller ones next time. Ping pong ball sized batter as opposed to golf ball batter would give 24 L cakes as opposed to 12 XL ones.
I love this recipe. I've made it 10 times or so now and it's perfect.
I followed the recipe exactly except reduced it for 4 portions. It was delicious. We ate it as rolls with supper and then as shortcake with strawberries for dessert. Great as both.

Made these for Father’s Day and followed the recipe exactly except did not use lemon juice in the berries. Tender and delicious! Don’t skimp on the turbinado sugar - it really makes it even more delicious, and pretty too!
I didn't have any buttermilk so I used 3/4 cup of 2% and 1/4 18% cream with about a tablespoon of vinegar to sour it. Excellent recipe!
I thought it was okay. Shortcake seemed a little bitter

I made a half recipe (10 smaller servings) since I didn't want stale leftovers. I used muffin tins with canola spray and was able to shave a few minutes off the baking time. Using normal white sugar on top still worked fine. I used the suggestion of the food processor for adding the butter and will be doing that from now on - worked like a charm with cold butter from the fridge. These were more moist than other shortcakes I've made.

My kids made this with their babysitter- they had experimented with making butter from heavy cream which resulted in homemade butter as well as buttermilk and had gone strawberry picking so this was the perfect recipe to use all their efforts! She told me it was really easy and they definitely turned out delicious esp with fresh whipped cream on top. We also subbed brown sugar for the turbinado and cut in half to make 5 pretty big biscuits. Will definitely make again, this would be great for a summer picnic where everyone could assemble their own.
I made just the biscuits. My oven doesnt cook evenly, but I called it done at 10 minutes with convection.

This recipe for biscuits is amazing. I got rave reviews from my family. Had to make more the following week. They are definitely best the fresher you have them. I usually make in afternoon for after dinner dessert. Followed the biscuit recipe except I didn't have buttermilk so I soured some regular milk with 1Tbsp lemon juice to 1 c .milk.
Came out awesome!!

What an amazing recipe! The shortcakes provided such a sweet/savory taste and the texture was the perfect complement to the strawberries and syrup and whipped cream. Had some homemade vanilla ice cream that we added for the first round of shortcakes. DELISH and very simple and quick to make!
Made this exactly except didn’t have the turbinado sugar, but it was perfect. Super easy and quick. Only baked for 13 minutes and let sit on pan a couple more.
I adjusted the recipe as there are only 2 of us and it was delicious!
Delicious as is!

Made it exactly as written, but needed a little more buttermilk for consistency. They were perfect, old-fashioned shortcakes. We had some of the best fresh strawberries ever to put on top, as well as whipped cream - perfect spring dessert!

Very simple to make. Nice clean classic taste. I made mine with King Arthur gluten free flour. I added an additional 1/2 tsp of baking powder and an extra pinch of baking soda to help the rise. I put a spring
Loved these buttermilk biscuits with raw sugar. The bigger the crystals of raw sugar, the crunchier the top layer is. The lemon juice in the strawberries makes all the difference. Delicious.

Best shortcake I’ve ever made!
Minor changes: added 1t vanilla at the same time as the buttermilk, slightly less salt, coated the tops with 1/2&1/2 and brown sugar.
Served with fruit and whip cream for a delicious brunch treat.
So easy and so good! I cut it in half since it’s just two of us.

It was an amazing delicious recipe! Super easy and the shortcake was just slightly sweet, just perfect! I actually cut the recipe in half because I was making it for only 6 people and it was perfect!!!
Holy cow, this is so good! It is perfect with the strawberries! Loved it
Turned out pretty good
good standard shortcake/biscuit
Quick, easy recipe. Turned out great as a half recipe. Added blueberries and raspberries to the strawberry mixture. Served with homemade vanilla whip cream. Delicious. Will definitely make again.

This is always a huge hit when I make it. I mash the strawberries slightly after they have been sitting in sugar. Fresh lime juice works well. Thanks to another reviewer, I top with the 
Easy Whipped Cream recipe from this site. Perfection !!
Very good! I used white whole wheat flour, which, with the buttermilk, gave it a lovely golden color all the way through.
These are the perfect texture and taste.
These are shortcake nirvana!
Great recipe! I grated the butter using the small holes of the box grater and substituted 1 cup plain yogurt for the buttermilk - very tasty!
Kids loved the biscuits. Made it for dinner dessert and then again for breakfast the next morning.
This turned out great!!! Everyone loved it!!! Next time I am going to up the amount of buttermilk a bit. Was a bit dry.

Not sure how everybody else did it but it didn't work for me at all. I followed measurements and instructions to the T and I got a crumbly mess that would not come together. It fell out of the 1/3 cup measuring cup into a crumbly heap. I had to knead it and knead it before I could form any kind of shape with it.
Excellent!
It was okay but not what I was looking for. I will try another recipe next time.
It was okay but not what I was looking for. I will try another recipe next time.

This light and slightly sweet biscuit was great with fresh strawberries. I cut recipe in half as suggested. The leftovers were delicious at room temperature for breakfast the next morning. Will definitely make again.
Delicious. The biscuits are so light and yummy.
Wow! Excellent and easy recipe!!!
I didn’t make any changes to the recipe. It was simple and easy and soooo good. I will definitely make this again. I’m going to use the recipe for regular biscuits, too by leaving out the sugar.

I made this recipe three times this week - it is my new go to dessert. It is simple, quick, and delicious. I added an extra tablespoon of buttermilk in my third batch, and it was my best batch by far. I served sandwich style with fresh whipped cream and strawberries. I think we will be having this often this summer!
The best shortcake that I've made. Family loved them.

I think the recipe is good. I had some strawberry sauce from Chef John's recipe ready in my fridge and decided to prepare these biscuits. As some mentioned, be watchful of the baking time and the temperature. Adjust both as needed depending on your oven and baking sheet. I served it with a bit of vanilla ice cream and it was good. I might make this recipe again but with the original strawberry sauce to compare. If you have some fruit sauce try this recipe for the biscuits just follow the suggestions above and you should be fine.

This recipe is fantastic. I’ve made it about 5 times and received rave reviews from everyone. I’ve slightly modified the recipe and would recommend trying this as well. Add about a palm full of brown sugar and a half of a teaspoon of cinnamon to the dry ingredients. It won’t seem like much but the subtleness of those in this recipe make a really intriguing depth of flavor. Thanks!

These are so good! Easy to make and pretty forgiving if you don't have all the exact ingredients. I made buttermilk with whole milk and lemon juice, used mild to brush the tops before baking and used regular sugar for the tops. Still came out great. It might be even better with all the "right" ingredients, but was great just the way I made.
It was a big hit with young and old.
Mine burned on the bottoms a little every time ... maybe I should cook at a lower temperature for a little longer
I followed the recipe as is with the exception of having to add more butter milk than called for because the dough was dry. They turned out wonderfully, pretty & appetizing and were delicious!

Delicious! The buttermilk biscuits are so light and fluffy! I used vanilla ice cream instead of whipped cream. My daughter told me that these Strawberry Shortcakes taste Better than the one at the Cheesecake Factory! That’s is on heck of a compliment! Will definitely make again and again!
Delicious with just the right sweetness! Light and fluffy too!

Beautiful, crisp biscuits. They crumbled easily (I like mine broken in a bowl to collect more juice) and had a great flavor. I took them to a ladies meeting at church and everyone raved that they were just like they had growing up; two ladies asked for the recipe!
Excellent recipe. Like one reviewer noted watch the baking time.
Excellent recipe. Like one reviewer noted watch the baking time.
I didn't use the strawberry part of the recipe, just the shortbread. It was very good! I cut the shortbread in half and added whipped cream and sliced strawberries! Everyone loved it!
Easy and DEEEE-licious!
I halved the recipe and got 6 nice size biscuits we had them with strawberry’s and again with peaches .i will definitely make these again.this is a keeper!
No changes, turned out amazing, my husband can’t stop raving.....

These are really good. I only needed six so I cut the recipe in half. It worked great. Baking time was only 14 minutes, came out perfect. Make sure you use unsalted butter bc the added salt is enough. They are not to dense and not to light / airy. Perfect.
We used unsalted butter but worked the batter/dough with a pastry cutter for a long time. They were delicate, light and slightly sweet. Truly the best shortcake!!

just like the shortcake I grew up with. Really enjoyed it warm with a little milk and strawberries. Don't tell anyone but we ate it for supper! LOL
I make it as written with no changes.
The only change I made was to halve the recipe. The shortcake recipe was the best I've had or made in the past. Perfect lightness and crumble. Nice level of sweetness. I will make this again.
Very tasty strawberry shortcake. The biscuits were light and fluffy.
super easy to make. A light fluffy inside with a bit of crunch outside. Everyone loved them!

Yes. It tastes like biscuits...just like it is supposed to do. We are not fans of strawberry shortcakes that use those round spongecake holders or other white cake...those are not shortcakes. This recipe is excellent as written. This will be my go-to from now on. Andy's, the nearby ice cream shop that makes great strawberry shortcake sundaes, has just lost our business.

These Buttermilk Shortcakes are melt in your mouth delicious! I followed the recipe as written except I did not top shortcakes with heavy cream or turbinado sugar. This recipe will definitely be a regular for other desserts calling for shortcakes or biscuits!!

My family loved these!! Even a few days later they were good by reheating/crisping them up in the oven. I made them exactly as written but today I'm going to try them with a none gluten flour as we have numerous GF people coming for a barbecue.

This is my favorite strawberry shortcake recipe. The cream on the top with the sugar really makes it! I wasn't sure what turbinado sugar was, because I'm a cook and not a baker, but I used Sugar in the Raw and it turned out great... Turns out they're the same thing. Lol these biscuits can be used with any number of toppings, such as whipped pumpkin cream cheese, and they are amazing.
Didn’t change a thing - perfectly delicious as is - this has become my new go-to strawberry shortcake.

Really easy to make and very tasty. I didn't have unsalted butter or butter milk. So I used regular butter and didn't add the salt. As for the butter milk I mixed a cup of milk with 2 Tbsps of vinegar for 10 minutes. 

Only thing I would change next time is less strawberries. The shortcakes have finished, and I'm left with the strawberry mixture. Would recommend using 5 cups instead of 8.
Made it exactly as listed and they were wonderful! A big hit for Easter dinner.

As a shortbread this didn't cut it for me. It is to much like a biscuit. Looking at the ingredients I decided to make it to use as a biscuit, a dessert biscuit. Next time I will use 3/4 tsp salt because I use salted butter. As a dessert biscuit, absolutely fabulous. I did not use sugar on the tops.
Yum! I couldn't stop eating them! They weren't beautiful, but who cares!

this was nasty. it's not cake it's a biscuit with fruit! just didn't see how this can b called CAKE (shortcake) I could've just eaten biscuits and jam. not saying ur recipe is wrong just not what I expected for a type of cake with strawberries and whipped cream not a good combination.
Definitely a keeper.
Really good and simple to make I love it
This recipe s delicious! I will definitely make them again. The biscuits are great on their own but even better with the strawberries and cream. This was a big hit with my family.
Best biscuit recipe ever. Had to add extra liquid to get all ingredients to be moist. Probably, 1/3-1/2 cup more.

This makes just the perfect biscuit-style strawberry shortcake. The only change I made was to use honey instead of sugar by adding the honey to a little bit of warmed up buttermilk. Using a 1/3 cup measuring cup as a scoop, I only got 10 biscuits, not 12.
Rainy day, no angel food cake, I decided to make this for our strawberry shortcake. Husband was wild about it!
Did not sift flour and other dry ingredients. Turns out my sifter didn't work very well. But biscuits turned out great. Used them to make strawberry shortcake. So good!
Wonderful, light biscuits. Easy to make. Everyone loved them.

This was simple & delicious! I didn't have buttermilk, so added a tablespoon of apple cider vinegar to a cup of milk & it worked fine. I will shorten the baking time to 13 minutes next time, but will definitely make these again!
Really great shortcake, fluffy yet biscuit like, and just the right amount of sweetness. I didn't make the strawberry recipe, just the shortcake :)

Excellent and easy to make. I was out of buttermilk and substituted regular milk + 1 tsp. vinegar, as advised by another reviewer, and it was still over the moon wonderful. I forgot the cream/sugar topping before baking, and brushed on some milk a few minutes toward the end. Worked fine. When mixing, resist the urge to over-mix and, if in doubt about correct amount of milk, don't be afraid to err on the dry side, adding a touch more as you reach the dough for the last few biscuits at the bottom of the bowl
